jade.core
Class GConsole

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  jade.core.Console
                      jade.core.GConsole
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GConsole
extends Console

GConsole takes a regular Jade Console and adds the capability to use graphical tiles instead of ColoredChar. This is done by using the camera methods and by registering substitute tiles for ColoredChars. Otherwise, this console behaves exactly the same way as a basic Jade Console.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

GConsole

public GConsole()
Constructs a default GConsole. As opposed to the normal Jade Console, the tileWidth matches the tileHeight. The default tile size is 32x32 pixels with a width and height of 24 tiles.

GConsole

public GConsole(int tileSize,
                int width,
                int height)
Constructs a GConsole with a specified size.

Parameters:
tileSize - the number of pixels wide and high in pixels of each individual tile.
width - the number of tiles wide the GConsole starts with
height - the number of tiles high the GConsole starts with

buffCamera

public void buffCamera(Camera camera,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       Coord coord,
                       char ch,
                       java.awt.Color color)
Performs the same as in a normal JadeConsole, only that any registered images will be used in place of the ascii representation of each tile.

Overrides:
buffCamera in class Console
Parameters:
camera - the camera to be used.
x - the x-coordinate of the camera on screen
y - the y-coordinate of the camera on screen
coord - the map coordinate to be drawn.
ch - the char to be drawn at coord
color - the color of the char to be drawn at coord

registerImage

public boolean registerImage(java.lang.String tileSet,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             char ch,
                             java.awt.Color color)
Registers an image to replace a specific ascii representation of a tile. It works by finding the tile in the file tileSet at (x,y) of the tileSize of this GConsole. Any time the camera is then used, this tile will replace it.

Parameters:
tileSet - the file containing the tile set.
x - the x-coordinate of the specific tile wanted
y - the y-coordinate of the specific tile wanted
ch - the char of the ColoredChar to replace
color - the color of the ColoredChar to replace
Returns:
true if the substitution was successful
